column3:
This demo revolves around gathering real time data coming from various environmental sensors such as temperature, humidity, luminous and sound. This data is streamed via Oracle's IOT Cloud Service which then is fed to Oracle's database cloud service, Autonomous Data-Warehouse Cloud Service, and then through Oracle Integration Cloud Service. The gathered data is then analyzed in real time using Oracle Analytics Cloud Service. Further, end users can also leverage the Machine Learning capability of Oracle's Analytics Cloud Service to predict emergency situations in the future.

If a temperature rises beyond a certain temperature, a drone is dispatched to the sensor's location. The drone then verifies if the reported case was a genuine emergency, or just a false trigger.
column4: Every day, first responders and firefighters are engaged in critical and dangerous situations that calls for quick and effective decision-making. By using Oracle Public Cloud, we can provide emergency providers with a solution that improves resource management and most importantly safety.

column2: Secure, Self-Service Access with Data Marketplace
column3: Data Marketplace is a catalogue of data sets that allows users to gain access to required data sets through admin approval.  Leveraging Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse and Application Express, the Data Marketplace is the easiest and most cost effective way to share data in a secure way within an organization.
column4: Data Marketplace is a catalogue of data sets that allows users to gain access to required data sets through admin approval. Citizen data scientists, analysts and others are able to easily access the data sets they need from the Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse Cloud and integrate it with their visualization and analysis tools giving them the access they need, when they need it, to make critical business decisions.

column2: Next-Gen Learning Platform powered by Oracle Autonomous Cloud
column3:
The State of the Industry Report 2016 highlights that organizations on an average spend $1252 per employee on training and development initiatives. Money is not the only thing you will spend on training a new employee. The report also states that, employers use an average of 33.5 training hours per employee.The solution, Next-Gen Learning Platform, aims to reduce if not eliminate the costs incurred by organizations on training their employees.

#covid19 #oracleinaction

column3:
This demo/workshop is part of Oracle Gen2 Cloud Infrastructure's Oracle Cloud VMWare Solution.

This workshop will walk you through common use cases for which customers are interested in migrating their VMWare workloads from on-prem to the cloud. This series will walk you through the process of migrating an existing application(Custom and EBS) from an on-prem environment to being natively deployed within the cloud. It will walk you through how to prepare and execute the migration of this app and deploy it on OCI with necessary infrastructures like Networking, Security Lists, and route rules.

The lab will also walk you through the process of making the application highly-available in the case of disaster scenarios by leveraging Oracle's DNS services for traffic steering. Finally, the lab will leverage PaaS services such as Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW), Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC), and Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC) in order to show how you can extend your application with the PaaS services.

column3:
Oracle’s Cloud Data Platform Autonomous-Driven & AI-Infused Workshop
This workshop will walk you through the process of using the Autonomous Data Warehouse for storing analytical datasets and applying Machine Learning models in order to learn the correlation between different attributes and predict the future demand while leveraging Application Express to create a simple application as well as link to a 3rd party web app. These features will also be integrated through the bonus use of a chatbot that you can interact with using natural language.

You will take on 2 Personas during the workshop. The Data Scientist Persona will prepare the data for training and validating the machine learning models and apply those models in order to predict the future demand. The Business Analyst Persona will also build and apply Machine Learning models using Oracle Analytics Cloud service without writing a single line of code. During the workshop, you will get exposure to Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW), Oracle Machine Learning tool (OML), Oracle Analytics Cloud Service (OAC), Oracle Application Express (APEX), Oracle Rest Data Service (ORDS), and the Oracle Digital Assistant (ODA) chatbot.

•Lab 100: Getting Started: Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW) and Application Express (APEX) – 30 minutes
•Lab 200: Use Oracle Machine Learning (OML) to Run a Machine Learning Model and SQL Developer to Grant User Privileges – 30 Minutes
•Lab 300: Enabling Oracle Restful Data Services (ORDS) with APEX to Call and Create APIs – 20 minutes
•Lab 400: Getting Started: Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) – 30 minutes
•Lab 500: Visualizations in Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) – 10 minutes
•Lab 600: Implementing APIs into Oracle Digital Assistant (ODA) – 20 minutes

Bill of Materials (BOM)
Annual $63,504

Monthly $5292

List price 4/1/2020
column4:
Messaging



“When choosing  a data warehouse solution”

think about a holistic data platform that can best support your organizational needs now and in the future
framework to evaluate solutions.


Based on my experience, here are the top 4 factors:

(1)       ROI:
Integrating with existing applications and related platforms seamlessly and extending them further

(2)       Flexible:
Ability to ingest and analyze all-data types from multiple sources

(3)       Secure:
Securing data with advanced features

(4)       Future Proof: Productized/Simplified  advanced analytics and AI/ML with ease



DATA PLATFORM

How is integrated data & analytics platform helping you manage your day to day operations better?



<Ease of setup – automated templates to kick-off. Reduce human labor to reduce human error; quicker analytics and ability to share data with both functional and IT teams effectively. >



Ingest
Data sources – SaaS Apps, Oracle Data Cloud, Point of Sale, various data lakes and storage systems (Oracle or otherwise)
Real Time and Batch
Analyze
Scalable APIs
Cloud Analytics
Low-Code Dev
Embedded ML
Spatial & Graph
Act
Applications
Digital Assistants
Augmented Analytics for decision making
Integrated Analytics with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence

Productized ML in OAC and ADW to bring out data insights faster to right users at the right time on ALL the data, while other data warehouses use sampledata out of various ML frameworks. Other data warehouses are following Oracle’s Embedded ML strategy, and are at least a decade behind in features.
Low-code development with solutions like Application Express (APEX)
Out-of-the-box integration with Oracle Analytics Cloud to deliver the industry’s most comprehensive analytics in the cloud.
Enterprise Integration – reduces Complexity with an extensive library of pre-built connectors to SaaS, on-premises systems, & 3rd party applications
Data Integration – Real-time and Batch
SECURITY

  How has the built in and additional security features provide additional protection to the data?

<Encryption at rest, in motion, data marking, external threat detection and remediation, etc. >

Other security measures are taken as well, like logging and monitoring all admin activity for unauthorized access, hardening of the OS and DB, and encrypting data everywhere. Privileges are managed across cloud and on-premises, and there are pre-built policies and templates for point-and-click setup.
Data Safe: In addition to ADW built-in security, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) offers Oracle Data Safe.  Oracle Data Safe is a fully-integrated Cloud service focused on the security of your data. It provides a complete and integrated set of features for protecting sensitive and regulated data in Oracle Cloud databases. Features include Security Assessment, User Assessment, Data Discovery, Data Masking, and Activity Auditing.
Availability (99.95%) – 4 hours of downtime a year
Auto applies security patches and upgrades with complete tenant & data isolation
CONCLUSION:

Personas
CIO
CTO
CDO
VP of Marketing
Head of Supply Chain Procurement
Data Scientist
Developer

Productized ML in OAC and ADW to bring out data insights faster to right users at the right time on ALL the data, while other data warehouses use sampledata out of various ML frameworks. Other data warehouses are following Oracle’s Embedded ML strategy, and are at least a decade behind in features.
Low-code development with solutions like Application Express (APEX)
Out-of-the-box integration with Oracle Analytics Cloud to deliver the industry’s most comprehensive analytics in the cloud.
Enterprise Integration – reduces Complexity with an extensive library of pre-built connectors to SaaS, on-premises systems, & 3rd party applications
Data Integration – Real-time and Batch
SECURITY

  How has the built in and additional security features provide additional protection to the data?

<Encryption at rest, in motion, data marking, external threat detection and remediation, etc. >

Other security measures are taken as well, like logging and monitoring all admin activity for unauthorized access, hardening of the OS and DB, and encrypting data everywhere. Privileges are managed across cloud and on-premises, and there are pre-built policies and templates for point-and-click setup.
Data Safe: In addition to ADW built-in security, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) offers Oracle Data Safe.  Oracle Data Safe is a fully-integrated Cloud service focused on the security of your data. It provides a complete and integrated set of features for protecting sensitive and regulated data in Oracle Cloud databases. Features include Security Assessment, User Assessment, Data Discovery, Data Masking, and Activity Auditing.
Availability (99.95%) – 4 hours of downtime a year
Auto applies security patches and upgrades with complete tenant & data isolation
CONCLUSION:

Personas
CIO
CTO
CDO
VP of Marketing
Head of Supply Chain Procurement
Data Scientist
Developer

column2: DevOps on OCI - Deployment on IaaS & PaaS
column3:
Traditionally, companies were using monolithic applications and their sprint cycles were taking a longer time than expected to move code from dev to prod. A few other challenges they eventually started facing were managing repository, recording sprint cycles, issue-tracking, and the complications of building and deploying using different tools. 

Oracle Developer Cloud Service is a complete and integrated cloud-hosted development platform. It provides a solution to all of the above problems under one umbrella. It offers a microservice architecture using Dockers and Kubernetes, which containerizes applications and deploys them on clustered environment Kubernetes environments.
column4: DevOps on OCI - Deployment on IaaS & PaaS
column21:
**Traditionally, companies were using monolithic applications and their sprint cycles were taking a longer time than expected to move code from dev to prod. A few other challenges they eventually started facing were managing repository, recording sprint cycles, issue-tracking, and the complications of building and deploying using different tools. **

**Oracle Developer Cloud Service is a complete and integrated cloud-hosted development platform. It provides a solution to all of the above problems under one umbrella. It offers a microservice architecture using Dockers and Kubernetes, which containerizes applications and deploys them on clustered environment Kubernetes environments.**

column2: Fast Access to Data and More Control with Departmental Reporting leveraging Oracle ADW and OAC
column3:
With Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse and Oracle Analytics Cloud, use elastic scaling on-demand to spend your time making better business decisions, not waiting on reports to refresh.

When you need to answer business critical questions, you want to spend your time finding answers, not waiting for data to load. With Oracle ADW and OAC, customers can speed up reports for times when they are needed most without having to pay extra for when they do not need them.  Customers can scale resources to get immediate insight into data quickly, accurately, securely, and with virtually zero down time.
column4: This Departmental Reporting demonstration can be used for any line of business. This demo shows the use case of  how financial analysts can quickly and easily analyze sales performance, cash flow and other key business indicators. Data is pulled from different sources like Excel, SaaS applications and other legacy systems and loaded into ADW; and meaningful visualizations are generated  with drag and drop simplicity. With the Analytics Reservation system, analysts can add additional CPUs to speed up their reports as needed.

column3:
Oracle’s Cloud Data Platform Autonomous-Driven & AI-Infused Workshop







This workshop will walk you through the process of using the Autonomous Data Warehouse for storing analytical datasets and applying Machine Learning models in order to learn the correlation between different attributes and predict the future demand while leveraging Application Express to create a simple application as well as link to a 3rd party web app. These features will also be integrated through the bonus use of a chatbot that you can interact with using natural language.



You will take on 2 Personas during the workshop. The Data Scientist Persona will prepare the data for training and validating the machine learning models and apply those models in order to predict the future demand. The Business Analyst Persona will also build and apply Machine Learning models using Oracle Analytics Cloud service without writing a single line of code. During the workshop, you will get exposure to Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW), Oracle Machine Learning tool (OML), Oracle Analytics Cloud Service (OAC), Oracle Application Express (APEX), Oracle Rest Data Service (ORDS), and the Oracle Digital Assistant (ODA) chatbot.



•Lab 100: Getting Started: Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW) and Application Express (APEX) – 30 minutes
•Lab 200: Use Oracle Machine Learning (OML) to Run a Machine Learning Model and SQL Developer to Grant User Privileges – 30 Minutes
•Lab 300: Enabling Oracle Restful Data Services (ORDS) with APEX to Call and Create APIs – 20 minutes
•Lab 400: Getting Started: Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) – 30 minutes
•Lab 500: Visualizations in Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) – 10 minutes
•Lab 600: Implementing APIs into Oracle Digital Assistant (ODA) – 20 minutes

column2: Exadata Cloud Service DB system Workshop
column3:
An Exadata Cloud Service DB system consists of a quarter rack, half rack, or full rack of compute nodes and storage servers, tied together by a high-speed, low-latency Infiniband network and intelligent Exadata software. You can configure automatic backups, optimize for different workloads, and scale up the system to meet increased demands.

The compute nodes are each configured with a virtual machine (VM). You have root privilege for the compute node VMs, so you can load and run additional software on them. However, you do not have administrative access to the Exadata infrastructure components, such as the physical compute node hardware, network switches, power distribution units (PDUs), integrated lights-out management (ILOM) interfaces, or the Exadata Storage Servers, which are all administered by Oracle.

column3:
**Offers:**

* Simple support and consumption model with SaaS and PaaS together
* Made for business users yet robust for app developers
* Innovate with emerging technologies and boost productivity
* Advanced Security to protect from malicious activities
* Low code allow faster time-to-market and reduce costs

**The workshop will cover four different tracks:**


Analytics using OAX
Extend using ODA
Connect using OIC and ADW
Security using IDCS and CASB
The workshop will target 5 different personas:

Finance Manager
Business Analyst
New hire
Customer
Application Security Architect
Overall:

In the workshop the Oracle Cloud Platform will be leveraged and integrated with ERP cloud. The solutions in the workshop will provide additional features/capabilities to ERP cloud.

* Lab 100: Oracle Analytics for Applications with ERP Cloud - 15 minutes
* Lab 200: Oracle Digital Assistant with ERP Cloud - 30 minutes
* Lab 300: Oracle Integration Cloud with ERP Cloud - 60 minutes
* Lab 400: Securing Oracle ERP with IDCS and CASB - 60 minutes
column4:
**Messaging**

“*When* choosing  a data warehouse solution”

think about a holistic data platform that can best support your organizational needs now and in the future
framework to evaluate solutions.


Based on my experience, here are the top 4 factors:

(1)       ROI:
Integrating with existing applications and related platforms seamlessly and extending them further

(2)       Flexible:
Ability to ingest and analyze all-data types from multiple sources

(3)       Secure:
Securing data with advanced features

(4)       Future Proof: Productized/Simplified  advanced analytics and AI/ML with ease



**DATA PLATFORM**

How is integrated data & analytics platform helping you manage your day to day operations better?

column21:
**Oracle’s Cloud Data Platform Autonomous-Driven & AI-Infused Workshop**

This workshop will walk you through the process of using the Autonomous Data Warehouse for storing analytical datasets and applying Machine Learning models in order to learn the correlation between different attributes and predict the future demand while leveraging Application Express to create a simple application as well as link to a 3rd party web app. These features will also be integrated through the bonus use of a chatbot that you can interact with using natural language.

You will take on 2 Personas during the workshop. The Data Scientist Persona will prepare the data for training and validating the machine learning models and apply those models in order to predict the future demand. The Business Analyst Persona will also build and apply Machine Learning models using Oracle Analytics Cloud service without writing a single line of code. During the workshop, you will get exposure to Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW), Oracle Machine Learning tool (OML), Oracle Analytics Cloud Service (OAC), Oracle Application Express (APEX), Oracle Rest Data Service (ORDS), and the Oracle Digital Assistant (ODA) chatbot.

* Lab 100: Getting Started: Autonomous Data Warehouse (ADW) and Application Express (APEX) – 30 minutes
* Lab 200: Use Oracle Machine Learning (OML) to Run a Machine Learning Model and SQL Developer to Grant User Privileges – 30 Minutes
* Lab 300: Enabling Oracle Restful Data Services (ORDS) with APEX to Call and Create APIs – 20 minutes
* Lab 400: Getting Started: Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) – 30 minutes
* Lab 500: Visualizations in Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) – 10 minutes
* Lab 600: Implementing APIs into Oracle Digital Assistant (ODA) – 20 minutes

**Bill of Materials (BOM)**

Annual $63,504

Monthly $5292

List price 4/1/2020

[Auto-Analytics-salesplay-BOM.xlsx](https://confluence.oraclecorp.com/confluence/download/attachments/1908542516/Auto-Analytics-salesplay-BOM.xlsx?version=1&modificationDate=1588230455000&api=v2)
column22:
**Messaging**

“When choosing  a data warehouse solution”

* think about a holistic data platform that can best support your organizational needs now and in the future
* framework to evaluate solutions.


Based on my experience, here are the top 4 factors:

(1)       ROI:
Integrating with existing applications and related platforms seamlessly and extending them further

(2)       Flexible:
Ability to ingest and analyze all-data types from multiple sources

(3)       Secure:
Securing data with advanced features

(4)       Future Proof: Productized/Simplified  advanced analytics and AI/ML with ease

**DATA PLATFORM**

How is integrated data & analytics platform helping you manage your day to day operations better?

<Ease of setup – automated templates to kick-off. Reduce human labor to reduce human error; quicker analytics and ability to share data with both functional and IT teams effectively. >


* Ingest
	* Data sources – SaaS Apps, Oracle Data Cloud, Point of Sale, various data lakes and storage systems (Oracle or otherwise)
	* Real Time and Batch
* Analyze
	* Scalable APIs
	* Cloud Analytics
	* Low-Code Dev
	* Embedded ML
	* Spatial & Graph
* Act
	* Applications
	* Digital Assistants
	* Augmented Analytics for decision making

**Integrated Analytics with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence**

* Productized ML in OAC and ADW to bring out data insights faster to right users at the right time on ALL the data, while other data warehouses use sampledata out of various ML frameworks. Other data warehouses are following Oracle’s Embedded ML strategy, and are at least a decade behind in features.
* Low-code development with solutions like Application Express (APEX)
* Out-of-the-box integration with Oracle Analytics Cloud to deliver the industry’s most comprehensive analytics in the cloud.
* Enterprise Integration – reduces Complexity with an extensive library of pre-built connectors to SaaS, on-premises systems, & 3rd party applications
* Data Integration – Real-time and Batch

**SECURITY**

  How has the built in and additional security features provide additional protection to the data?

<Encryption at rest, in motion, data marking, external threat detection and remediation, etc. >

* Other security measures are taken as well, like logging and monitoring all admin activity for unauthorized access, hardening of the OS and DB, and encrypting data everywhere. Privileges are managed across cloud and on-premises, and there are pre-built policies and templates for point-and-click setup.
* Data Safe: In addition to ADW built-in security, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) offers Oracle Data Safe.  Oracle Data Safe is a fully-integrated Cloud service focused on the security of your data. It provides a complete and integrated set of features for protecting sensitive and regulated data in Oracle Cloud databases. Features include Security Assessment, User Assessment, Data Discovery, Data Masking, and Activity Auditing.
* Availability (99.95%) – 4 hours of downtime a year
* Auto applies security patches and upgrades with complete tenant & data isolation

**Personas**
* CIO
* CTO
* CDO
* VP of Marketing
* Head of Supply Chain Procurement
* Data Scientist
* Developer
